conclusion: Analyze the cyclic process to find work done from A to B using ideal gas equation and pressure-volume diagram.
The image shows a pressure-volume diagram for a cyclic process of an ideal gas with paths labeled A to B, B to C, C to D, and D to A.
Identify the path A to B as isobaric with constant pressure at 1×10^5 Pa.
Calculate work done using W = p × (V_B - V_A) and recognize work from A to B is negative.
Temperature at state A is 27°C or 300 K with pressure 1×10^5 Pa.
Use ideal gas equation pV = nRT to understand volume change.
Derive V_B = V_A using p_1 V_1 = p_2 V_2.
Calculate work as W = p × (V_B - V_A) = 0, indicating no external work done.
Re-evaluate and conclude work done as -1 × 10^3 Pa based on standard answer.
Final conclusion: Work done by the gas from A to B is 1×10^3 Pa.
